ratings.comment: Goes above and beyond and willing to do anything to help you. He's too nice that sometimes it's cringeworthy because he's so scared of offending anyone. Tests very similar to practice tests(40% of grade). Hw is fine but can take long. High bar for A because everyone scores well and tests are open note. Final project course grading subjective asf.
Lectures were great and homework is manageable. 3 tests - 40%, homework - 20%, and the rest is participation/weekly assignments. Highly recommend.

Dmitry is such a genuine and caring guy, actually one of my favorite profs I've ever had. The material is tough but he does a great job of giving examples and the homework really nails in the concepts. He gives you a practice exam before the exam and runs through the entire thing with a video, which is just like the actual exam. Love this prof!!

Yes, this class is hard, but you can learn tons of useful practical things from it. Be prepared for the heavy homework, and if you don't keep up with the materials, you can get totally lost, so come prepared.

I second that the other reviews are too harsh, definitely nowhere near the worst b school prof. He couldn't explain tough concepts well, expected too much prior knowledge, if you can get past confusing parts you can get a lot out of the class. What wasn't understandable was the insane workload but he eventually lessened it. Absolutely hilarious tho

Some of the comments here are too rough. Dmitry is one of the most caring professors I ever had at UW-Madison. He gives his students everything. Yes, the material is hard and it takes time to digest stuff, but it will all come together if you put in the work. Also, this was Dmitry's first teaching experience at UW.

The midterm was hard but the average was much higher than anticipated. The concepts toward the end of the semester were helpful because they were on Excel (this is during the Coronavirus semester). He goes too fast and isn't good at explaining, you kind of figure it out the reasoning at the end. His slides have lots of info he never goes over.

Professor Orlov is the worst teacher I have had in my four years at UW. Not only are there typos in all of his slides, but he also makes students scared to ask questions and show up to class. He races through his lectures, which makes the material impossible to understand. The problem sets are also impossible.

Dmitry is a really nice guy outside of class who obviously cares about the subject. However, he doesn't seem to understand how difficult this material is for students and rushes through material. The examples he gives in class don't help at all with the homework and he doesn't take enough time to clarify what variables mean/where #'s come from.

This class has been awful. Professor Orlov has created an environment where his students scared to ask questions out of fear of being ridiculed or made look stupid. The examples in his slides are filled with many unexplained variables with no numbers involved. He goes way too quickly through units to be able to understand these difficult topics.
